text: {"grade": 1, "reasoning": "The response clearly distinguishes between jurisdictional review and merits review. Specifically, under section 2 ('Article V(1)(a) (jurisdiction/validity)'), it contrasts the court's role in determining 'Did we agree to arbitrate at all?' (often for courts) versus 'Does this dispute fall within the clause / what is the clause\u2019s scope?' (often for arbitrators), explicitly stating that US courts defer to the tribunal's jurisdiction ruling if delegation is clear. This directly addresses the requirement to distinguish between jurisdictional review and merits review.", "criterion_id": "e92f1752-19b6-4afc-9ea1-4277c9bf6cc0"}
